summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from April 2020 discussing case progress on the Epstein and Maxwell investigations. It reveals a backlog in processing digital evidence (CART) and mentions that SDNY management is expected to approve moving forward with the Maxwell case once Grand Juries resume.

persons.name: Steve
persons.role: CART (Computer Analysis and Response Team) analyst
persons.context: Mentioned as being assigned to the Epstein and Maxwell cases, responsible for processing a large volume of forensic evidence, but facing delays due to limited office presence.

events.title: SDNY Management Approval for Maxwell Case
events.description: An FBI email indicates that SDNY (Southern District of New York) management will approve moving forward with the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Discussion of Digital Evidence Backlog
events.description: FBI emails discuss a significant backlog in processing digital evidence (electronic downloads) from searches related to the Epstein and Maxwell cases, attributed to CART being in the office only 1-2 days a week.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively working on the Ghislaine Maxwell case in April 2020, awaiting SDNY management approval to proceed.
There was a significant backlog in processing digital forensic evidence (CART) from searches related to both the Epstein and Maxwell cases.
The backlog was exacerbated by reduced office presence (CART only in 1-2 days a week) during the referenced period, likely due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
The case team was suggested to use the time for taint review and electronic search reviews of already obtained evidence.
